summary: Build an offline-first application that uses locally stored Excel files as its primary database, including customer/property management with category filtering, automated buyer–seller matching alerts, and a reminder feature with a button-triggered date/time/notes workflow.
architectural_notes: Application is intended to run offline and persist all data locally on the user's PC using Excel files as the system of record.
Provide a user-configurable base folder (selected in Settings) for all stored data/documents; app should create/use necessary subfolders.

existing_features.title: Update the Customer/Buyer form and customer list UI to replace the field labeled “Need” with a “Category” dropdown (e.g., Land, House, Rental, etc.), and persist the selected category on the customer record while preserving backward compatibility with previously saved records that used the `need` field.

On the customer record details page, display a filtered list of property records based on the customer’s selected Category (e.g., Land/House/Rental/etc.), so the user can view relevant properties for that customer.

Implement automated buyer–seller matching and show matches as dismissible items on the Dashboard: compare Customer (buyer) records against non-Customer (seller/property) records using price/budget category and a small set of additional comparable fields, and keep showing newly found matches until the user dismisses them.

Change reminder creation so date/time/notes entry only appears after the user clicks an “Add Reminder” button; after saving, the reminder is stored and will trigger the existing due-reminder modal at the specified date/time.
Add Excel-based import/export for the local offline database in Settings, so users can use Excel files as the primary data interchange format instead of only JSON export/import.

new_feature_requests.summary: Customer page: rename 'Need' to 'Category' and implement a dropdown (Land/House/Rental/etc.) that filters/displays the relevant property list
Offline local data persistence: store all app data as Excel files on the user's PC (Excel as the database for forms and entries)
Settings: allow user to select a local drive/folder where the app will create/use folders to store all documents and data files
Automated matching: compare buyer and seller requirements (price categories and other criteria) and show matches on the dashboard until dismissed
Reminders: only open date/time/notes selection after clicking an 'Add Reminder' button; save/display reminder after creation

projectName: Customer category filtering, buyer–seller matching alerts, and button-driven reminder creation (offline local storage + Excel I/O)
